I have been using canvas for over 3 years now. I use it now more than ever, since I am doing virtual classes. I do have a suggestion: I recommend adding an audio/video call option, since I have to sign in to Zoom for all 5 of my daily video calls. It would just be nice to be able to click something and go straight to my classes. It could be easier for students in my district, since we have to have an authorized account for our calls. If we had calls on Canvas, no students would have to sign in every time and the teachers would know which student it is since most of us are signed in by name. It may not be possible to add that, but if there is, I would highly recommend it. Other than that, It's pretty ok. It lags a lot, especially on PC, and it's really a pain when I misspell something even when spelling doesn't count for our grade. Luckily, my teachers go in and look through our assignments and grade them even after they were "graded" by Canvas. I also would like to suggest adding a "go in and double-check" feature, because I often miss-click an answer and get it wrong. If these features are added and the problems are fixed, I might rate it 5 stars, depending on how good it is.

Maintaining a manually-written to-do list is one thing, but people can forget to add things to that list. People will be swamped with work and reviewing the week before finals only to be scared out of their seats because it turns out they forget to work on and submit THREE worksheets that only showed up in the calendar/online to-do list on the actual day it was due. I checked the due date religiously on the app and it wasn't there. And now that I've checked the Canvas WEBSITE it turns out the activity was around for already a WEEK and I never knew about it, because the calendar/to-do list of the app doesn't show everything.
